description: Step back into 1991 - De Underground Records Forest Gate East London, an inconspicuous record shop and studio - the people, the music, the vibe born out of a back street of east London that became the birthplace of Jungle music.

designers.architect: Uncle 22 and DJ Randall create the hotspot for 160BPM+ beats.

periods: Uncle 22 and DJ Randall create the hotspot for 160BPM+ beats.

factsheet.heading: Newham Heritage Blue Plaque
paragraphs:
London's legendary De Underground Records, shop and studio,
received a heritage plaque for contributions to 'UK hardcore,
jungle and drum & bass music'. The signs are used to identify
sites of cultural importance across Britain. In this case it was
issued by London Borough of Newham as a result of a heritage
project about the shop and studio by Rendezvous Projects in
2021. It is the first blue plaque to jungle in the UK.

factsheet.heading: Background
paragraphs:
Owned by Mike De Underground, Cool Hand Flex, Uncle 22 and
DJ Randall, it quickly became a hotspot for 160BPM+ beats.
A-Sides, MC Fats, Wacko and Marly Marl were also considered
part of the wider 'family', with a long list of visiting dignitaries
from the scene regularly stopping by. The address was home to a recording studio, laying claim to landmark releases such as 'We Are IE', 'Melody Madness' and 'Six Million Ways To Die'.

factsheet.heading: Cultural Diversity of Electronic Music
paragraphs:
De Underground Records’ history tells the story of mainly black
working-class young people, and the incredible impact their
ingenuity and creative expression had on a national phenomenon, helping to define a new and uniquely British sound and identity. Da Underground Records was formed on 18 Sebert Road in 1991 and the transition from synth pop, hip hop evolving into Jungle and Drum and Bass.

factsheet.heading: The Experience
paragraphs: At the core of the experience are a series of interviews and oral history testimonies from the main protagonists, visitors, producers, DJ’s and passers-by collected by Rendezvous Projects in 2021. These stories will be set within a 360 degree virtual reality experience - recreating the shop front, the ‘cave-like’ shop interiors and studio space, filled with the sound making technologies of the time; reel to reel tape machines, record press and turntables virtual environment, where a series of Virtual Reality headsets and objects allow viewers to step back into time into the record shops in 1991

name: Crate Digging: The Influence of De Underground Records
